If you have any questions about the state of athletics please contact Coach Marshall directly.

Thanks for your continued support of the Pride! #WeAreHC #HCPrideProud

Attention new students who have been ACCEPTED to Henderson Collegiate.

On Tuesday, July 21st between 11 A.M. and 3 P.M. we will be running a drop-off for all state required paperwork. Our team will make copies on site for you and return the paperwork. This process is required for all families to ensure that your student can be properly enrolled.

*New families will know that they are accepted if they have received a notification through SchoolMint and received a personal phone call.

Documents that are needed on this day:
1. Birth Certificate
2. Social Security Card
3. Immunization Records
4. Proof of Address (utility bill, lease, drivers license)
5. HS Students Only: Previous Final Year Transcript.

We look forward to meeting you all in person and are excited to have you join our HC family! #WeAreHC #HCPrideProud

ATTENTION: NEW STUDENTS who have been ACCEPTED to Henderson Collegiate.

*New families will know that they are accepted if they have received a notification through SchoolMint and received a personal phone call.

Documents that are needed on this day:
1. Birth Certificate
2. Social Security Card
3. Immunization Records
4. Proof of Address (utility bill, lease, drivers license)
5. HS Students Only: Previous Final Year Transcript.

We look forward to meeting you all in person and are excited to have you join our HC family! #WeAreHC #HCPrideProud

Our second student creation for Juneteenth is the poem "Carrington Ave" written and recorded by Aanyla Jackson, Pride of 2020.

On June 19, 1865, over two years after the Emancipation Proclamation was issued by President Lincoln, the Proclamation reached Texas with the Union Army's General Major Gordon Granger.

Juneteenth is a commemoration of this day, 155 years ago, that the last enslaved people in the United States were freed.

#WeAreHC #HCPrideProud #Juneteenth

Summer books will be given out at no cost this year.
Summer break packets will be posted online and students should plan to keep their devices for the summer.
If you cannot make the book drop off please reach out to the Director of Operations at your school via email or phone call.

Today, we lost one of the fiercest fighters for equity in Henderson, NC, and in the USA. Andrea Harris was a friend and a mentor. She fought for equal rights and equal opportunity for people of color and for women. Those who spent time with her, learned from her wisdom, loved her humor, and were enamored by her candor. Personally, I was always inspired by her energy and empowered by her embrace. Life is short and I wish that I had spent more time picking her brain, but I will always cherish the moments that we did have.

While I appreciate it, please don't send us your condolences. Instead, post memories that celebrate her life and/or spend time learning about her greatness, so that her legacy will be recognized and learned from by future generations. Please start by clicking the link below.

Thanks,
Mr. Sanchez

HC family, today is #GivingTuesday, and on this global day of giving, we encourage you to give locally!
Henderson Collegiate is a free public charter school that serves over 1,300 students with the mission of empowering our students to become better people and to become world-changing problem solvers.
Donate to the Pride today: https://hendersoncollegiate.networkforgood.com/

At Henderson Collegiate, each grade level cohort is known as a "Pride" and embraces their identity as a beloved community. We believe that 51% of our job is about empowering our children to become better people, and 49% is about strengthening their academic skills. The end result of achieving our mission is that our students will become better people, they will attend and graduate from the college of their choice, and they will become world-changing problem solvers.
#SupportThePride today. All donations will go to our college counseling program and will help us reach our goal of ensuring that 100% of our students attend and graduate from a college of their choice!

At our annual staff retreat, our Henderson Collegiate family honored the legacy of our good friend, Keith Burnam. The Keith Burnam Jr. award is earned by the teammate who extraordinary contribution extends past their job description to impact adults and children in multiple schools. This is fitting, because Keith dedicated his career in education fighting for social justice and he worked relentlessly to close the achievement gap. He has impacted and touched so many lives. We are excited to honor Keith, and his overall contribution to multiple schools, including ours.

This year’s recipient, Frank Terranova, has also worked tirelessly to ensure our students have the academic and character skills needed to be prepared to attend and graduate from the college or their choice and become world-changers. Eric Sanchez and I (Carice Sanchez) are grateful and fortunate to have him by our side, dedicating his life to our Henderson Collegiate family.

A special thanks to Syrena McKenzie Burnam, Lisa Burnam, and Keith’s parents for their support.
